# 總裁報告

2016年的全球政經舞台上「黑天鵝」身影頻仍，英國脫歐公投和美國總統大選結果固然令各種民調淪為笑柄，但更出乎意料的卻是金融市場的反應。以美國大選為例，特朗普當選消息令美股三大指數的期貨在開市前急挫，但開市不久美股指數隨即反彈，此後凱歌高奏，屢創新高。連串事件，凸顯了傳統智慧和思維對預測市場能力的局限性，也標誌着未來環球局勢發展的重大不確定性。

過去一年，多項主要金融數據都反映市場情緒異常敏感：美國十年期國庫債券收益率在7月跌至1.36厘歷史低位後，在美國總統大選後的12月中旬飆升至2.6厘。反映美元兌一籃子貨幣走勢的美匯指數在年底升至14年高位；紐約原油期貨價格由年初每桶26美元低位反彈至年底的54美元。本港股市方面，恒生指數全年微升86點，但期內峰谷差逾6,000點。外圍形勢驚濤駭浪，更形金融體系尤其是貨幣和銀行體系穩定的重要和可貴。

2016年1月，國際對沖基金部署狙擊人民幣和港元的傳言甚囂塵上，人心虛怯。金管局迅即向市場發放明確、堅定的訊息，我們絕對有信心、有能力捍衛聯匯制度和香港的金融體系穩定，適時穩住了市場信心。綜觀2016年全年，港元長時間貼近強方兌換保證。由於銀行體系資金非常充裕，即使去年12月和今年3月美國聯儲局加息，對港元利率和匯率並未有明顯的即時影響。

香港銀行體系繼續穩步發展，去年整體貸款錄得6.5%溫和增長，資產質素保持良好，不良貸款比率維持在0.85%的健康水平，遠低於2000年以來約2%的長期平均水平。銀行體系的資本充足率和流動性比率均保持在高於法定要求的高水平。在樓宇按揭業務方面，經過七輪逆周期措施，新造住宅物業按揭平均成數從2009年9月的64%下降至2016年底的51%，平均供款與入息比率也從2010年8月的41%下降至2016年底的34%，為樓市周期一旦逆轉而令銀行體系受到衝擊時，提供了所需的緩衝。金管局會繼續密切留意樓市的發展，因應周期變化而採取合適措施，以保持銀行體系穩定。

進一步強化銀行體系穩定的立法工作去年取得令人鼓舞的進展。優化存款保障制度和針對金融機構「大得不能倒」風險的兩條法例，及時在上屆立法會任期屆滿前順利通過。前者加快存款保障金的發放速度，簡化發放程序，有助加強存戶對銀行體系的信心；後者則為包括銀行在內的金融機構建立處置機制，防範這些機構一旦倒閉而引發的系統性金融風險，並盡量避免動用公帑為它們「包底埋單」。金管局已在今年4月1日設立處置機制辦公室，落實執行法例的要求和跟進工作。

銀行業素有「百業之母」之稱，是實體經濟和普羅市民日常生活倚重的儲蓄、支付渠道和信貸來源。年內，部分中小企業界代表反映融資有困難。金管局即時與銀行界溝通，希望銀行在維持審慎風險管理的情況下，盡可能為中小企的營運和發展繼續提供資金支援。我們又透過轄下香港按揭證券公司，加強向工商界推廣政府的「中小企融資擔保計劃」，並與銀行業界緊密溝通，以釋除疑慮、釐清誤解及理順處理壞帳的索償程序，從而提高銀行參與該計劃的意願。多管齊下，收到了一定成效，根據金管局對銀行進行的調查，中小企整體信貸額度在去年保持平穩，超過九成企業的信貸額度得以維持甚至增加。同時，「中小企融資擔保計劃」的申請數字亦明顯上升。

近年來金管局大力推動普及金融，就是考慮到基本銀行服務已是營商和日常生活不可或缺的環節。去年當我們得知有些海外公司和初創企業在香港開戶遇到困難後，旋即展開跟進工作，與多個國際商會和企業協會聯繫，並跟銀行業界深入溝通，對症下藥。去年9月我向香港所有銀行簽發通告，闡釋應如何理解金管局針對反洗錢和恐怖分子資金籌集活動的「風險為本」監管原則，如何將這項原則應用在開戶申請和對現有客戶的盡職審查措施上，強調銀行不應對所有客戶採用「一刀切」的要求和程序。經我們與銀行和商界協商後，企業開戶情況有所改善，但仍有進步空間，這也是我們今年工作重點之一。

普及金融還涉及銀行分行服務的覆蓋面。金管局一直鼓勵銀行在營商圖利之餘，也要顧及市民的基本銀行服務需要。金融科技一日千里，銀行提供服務的渠道也更趨多元化。除了日益普及的網上銀行服務外，去年多家銀行紛紛推出流動銀行車或視像櫃員機服務，提供較傳統櫃員機更貼身、更全面的銀行服務。在我們的推動下，多家銀行也計劃在偏遠地區設立實體分行，加強對當區居民的服務。

金融中心的發展就如逆水行舟，因此，金管局多年來不斷為香港金融業發展尋求新的契機，開拓新的領域。2016年可說是成果豐碩的一年，當中又以金融科技(Fintech)和基建融資為亮點。

在金融科技方面，香港的零售支付服務在2016年進入新時代。金管局去年發出13個儲值支付工具牌照，通過發牌和恒常監管制度為零售支付服務創造有利的營商環境，配以一系列公眾教育宣傳，讓消費者在享受新科技帶來的便捷之餘，權益也得到合理保障。

此外，去年3月金管局成立了金融科技促進辦公室，以此平台推動與銀行業相關的金融科技發展。幾個月間，我們推出多項新猷，包括「網絡防衛計劃」(Cybersecurity Fortification Initiative)，為強化銀行體系網絡安全建立風險評估、資訊共享和人才培訓三足鼎立的新平台。我們並與香港應用科技研究院（應科院）合作，開展分布式分類帳技術(distributed ledger technology)專項研究，探討該技術在香港銀行業應用的可行性，並在應科院設立金融科技創新中心(Fintech Innovation Hub)，為銀行業界和金融科技界提供技術支援。金管局的銀行監管部門還設立「金融科技監管沙盒」(Fintech Supervisory Sandbox)，讓銀行在較小和可控範圍內測試新技術的應用，為新產品、新服務的開發提速。自去年9月至今年3月，已有6家銀行共14項新技術項目使用沙盒進行測試，部分項目亦已相繼推出市場，為市民帶來更多金融科技的新產品。

世界各地對基建融資的需求巨大，特別是「一帶一路」倡議提出以來，基建融資更成中外矚目的議題。香港是亞洲的國際金融中心，在基建融資領域極具優勢。去年7月金管局成立了基建融資促進辦公室(Infrastructure Financing Facilitation Office，簡稱IFFO)，搭建一個嶄新和獨特的平台，匯聚60多家世界級的多邊機構、機構投資者、銀行、保險公司和其他金融機構、基建項目的建設和營運方、各類專業機構等，就基建投融資課題互通訊息、交流經驗、尋求合作機會。IFFO成立至今已舉辦十多場大型會議、研討會和工作坊，金管局並分別與國際金融公司(International Finance Corporation)、全球基礎設施中心(Global Infrastructure Hub)、國家開發銀行(China Development Bank)和中國進出口銀行(The Export-Import Bank of China)簽署了共同促進基建投融資活動的《諒解備忘錄》。起步時間雖然不長，但為香港未來作為基建投融資中心奠下堅實的基礎。

拆牆鬆綁是提升競爭力的不二法門。年內，金管局積極參與和支援特區政府修訂稅務條例，向在港經營集團內部財資業務的企業提供有利的稅務環境。我們並積極接觸跨國企業，吸引它們來港發展或擴充企業財資活動，藉此進一步強化香港金融市場的功能。

去年的離岸人民幣市場處於調整期。受市場波動和對人民幣匯率預期等因素影響，全球離岸人民幣資金池規模普遍收縮。儘管如此，香港仍穩執離岸人民幣業務的牛耳，保持全球最大的人民幣資金池，經香港結算的人民幣維持在日均約8,600億元人民幣高位。為進一步優化香港離岸人民幣市場的流動性安排，去年10月我們將一級流動性提供行由7家增至9家，支援雙邊流動資金的總額度由原來的140億元人民幣增至180億元，確保在離岸人民幣市場資金出現緊絀的情況下，仍可保持市場有序運作。去年12月股票市場「深港通」開通，令香港的人民幣業務再添動力。金管局亦正與內地有關當局研究「債券通」方案，進一步便利兩地投資者參與債券市場，並優化債券市場基礎設施的聯繫。

儘管去年全球投資環境充斥着各種不穩因素，但有賴於過去一段時間所採取的多項防禦性部署，外匯基金去年錄得681億港元投資收入。自1994年以來外匯基金的複合年度投資回報率達4.8%，高於同期2.1%的本地通脹率。

外匯基金將繼續推動多元化投資，包括進一步擴展資產類別，加大對於信貸資產、抵禦通脹類投資產品和新興市場的投資。而作為多元化投資旗艦的「長期增長組合」，透過私募股權和房地產項目等投資於另類資產。該組合自2009年啟動以來一直保持不俗的成績，成立至今的平均內部回報率年率約12%，而隨着政府「未來基金」部分投放於該組合，我們加快了投資步伐，去年底「長期增長組合」的資產規模約1,818億港元，已批出但未提取作投資的總額約1,338億港元。外匯基金將繼續恪守「保本先行、長期增值」的投資策略，在保持充裕的流動性和備用資金的前提下，尋求長遠穩定的回報。

# President's Report

In 2016, “black swan” events frequently appeared on the global political and economic stage. The Brexit referendum and the outcome of the US presidential election certainly rendered various polls laughable, but what was even more unexpected was the reaction of the financial markets. Taking the US election as an example, the news of Trump’s election led to an immediate plunge in the... US stock futures, but shortly after the market opened, US stock Index rebounded and subsequently trended upward, repeatedly reaching new highs. This series of events highlights the limitations of traditional wisdom and thinking in predicting market ability, and also marks a major uncertainty in the Future development of the global situation.

Over the past year, several major financial data points all reflected unusually sensitive market sentiments: the US 10-year Treasury bond yield fell to a record low of 1.36 in July before surging to 2.6 in mid-December following the US presidential election. The US dollar Index, reflecting the movements of the US dollar against a basket of currencies, rose to a 14-year high at year-end; New York crude oil futures rebounded from a low of $26 per barrel at the beginning of the year to $54 at year-end. Regarding the Hong Kong stock market, the Hang Seng Index saw a slight increase of 86 points for the whole year, but the difference between its peak and trough during the period exceeded 6,000 points. The external environment was turbulent, further enhancing the importance and preciousness of maintaining financial system stability, especially banking stability and monetary stability.

In January 2016, rumors swirled that international hedge funds were deploying to attack the renminbi and Hong Kong dollar, causing market anxiety. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority promptly released clear and firm information to the market, stating that we have absolute confidence and ability to defend the linked exchange rate system and the stability of Hong Kong’s financial system, thereby stabilizing market confidence in a timely manner. Looking back at the whole of 2016, the Hong Kong dollar remained close to the strong-side convertibility guarantee for a long time. Due to ample funding within the banking system, even the interest rate hikes by the US Federal Reserve in December last year and March this year did not have a significant immediate impact on Hong Kong dollar interest rates and exchange rates.

Hong Kong’s banking system will continue to develop steadily, with overall loans achieving 6.5% moderate growth last year, while asset quality remained healthy and the non-performing loan rate maintained a healthy level of 0.85%, well below the long-term average of approximately 2% since 2000. The banking system’s capital adequacy ratio and liquidity ratio both remained at high levels above statutory requirements. Regarding mortgage business, after seven rounds of counter-cyclical measures, the average loan-to-value (LTV) ratio for newly granted residential property mortgages decreased from 64% in September 2009 to 51% at the end of 2016, and the average debt-to-income ratio also declined from 41% in August 2010 to 34% at the end of 2016, providing the necessary Buffer for the banking system in the face of shocks should the property market reverse. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority will continue to monitor the development of the property market, and will take appropriate measures in accordance with cyclical changes to maintain banking stability.

Further strengthening legislative work on banking system stability made encouraging progress last year. Optimising the Deposit Protection Scheme and two pieces of legislation aimed at the risk of financial institutions being “too big to fail” were smoothly passed before the end of the last Legislative Council session. The former quickens the payout speed of the Deposit Protection Scheme, simplifies the payout process, and helps enhance depositors’ confidence in the banking system; the latter establishes a resolution regime for financial institutions including banks, preventing systemic financial risks should they fail, and to the extent possible avoiding the use of public funds to bail them out. The HKMA has already established a resolution office on April 1 of this year to implement the requirements of the legislation and follow-up work.

The banking sector is known as “the mother of all industries” and is the savings, payment channels, and credit Source relied upon by the real economy and the general public in their daily lives. Within the year, some representatives from small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) reflected difficulties in obtaining funding. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority immediately communicated with the banking sector, hoping that banks would continue to provide funding support for the operations and development of SMEs, while maintaining prudent risk management. We also strengthened the promotion of the Government’s “sMe Financing Guarantee Scheme” through our subsidiary, the Hong Kong Mortgage Corporation, and maintained close communications with the banking industry to dispel doubts, clarify misinterpretations and streamline the claims procedures for bad debts, thereby enhancing banks’ willingness to participate in the scheme. Through a multi-pronged approach, we have achieved a certain effectiveness. According to a survey of banks conducted by the Hong Kong Monetary Authority, the overall credit limit for SMEs remained stable last year, and the credit limit for over 90% of enterprises was maintained or even increased. At the same time, the number of applications for the “sMe Financing Guarantee Scheme” also increased significantly.

In recent years, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority has strongly promoted financial inclusion, recognizing that basic banking services are an indispensable part of doing business and daily life. Last year, when we learned that some overseas companies and startups were experiencing difficulties with account opening in Hong Kong, we immediately launched follow-up work, contacted a number of international chambers of commerce and business associations, and engaged in in-depth communications with the banking sector to address the issue. In September last year, I issued a circular to all banks in Hong Kong, explaining how to understand the HKMA’s “risk-based” regulatory principles for combating anti-money laundering and terrorist financing, how to apply this approach to account opening applications and due diligence reviews of existing clients, and emphasizing that banks should not adopt a “one-size-fits-all” approach and procedures for all customers. Following negotiations with banks and the business community, the situation regarding corporate account opening has improved, but there is still room for improvement, which is also one of our key priorities this year.

Financial inclusion also involves the coverage of bank branch services. The HKMA has consistently encouraged banks to consider the basic banking service needs of the public while pursuing business profits. Fintech is developing rapidly, and the channels banks provide services through are becoming more diversified. In addition to the increasingly popular online banking services, several banks launched mobile bank vehicles or video teller machines last year, providing more personalized and comprehensive banking services than traditional ATMs. With our promotion, several banks are also planning to establish real branches in remote areas, enhancing services for local residents.

The development of a financial centre is like swimming upstream. Therefore, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority has continuously sought new opportunities for the development of Hong Kong’s financial industry over the years, and explored new areas. 2016 can be described as a year of abundant results, including Fintech and infrastructure finance as highlights.

In the Fintech sector, Hong Kong’s retail payment services entered a new era in 2016. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority issued 13 stored value payment facilities licences last year, fostering a conducive environment for retail payment services through licensing and ongoing supervisory regime, coupled with a series of publicity to ensure that consumers’ ownership is reasonably protected while enjoying the convenience brought by new technology.

In addition, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) established the Fintech Facilitation office last March as a platform to promote the development of financial technology related to the banking sector. Over the past few months, we have launched several new initiatives, including the Cybersecurity Fortification Initiative, to establish a three-pronged new platform for risk assessment, information sharing, and talent development to strengthen the cybersecurity of the banking system. We also cooperate with the Applied Science and Technology Research Institute (ASTRI) to conduct specialized research on distributed ledger technology, explore the resolvability of its application in the Hong Kong banking sector, and establish a Fintech Innovation Hub at ASTRI to provide technical support to the banking sector and the Fintech community. The HKMA’s banking supervision department has also established a Fintech Supervisory Sandbox, allowing banks to test the application of new technologies in a smaller and controllable environment, accelerating the development of new products and services. From September last year to March this year, 6 banks have used the sandbox to test a total of 14 new technology projects, and some projects have been launched into the market in succession, providing members of the public with more new Fintech products.

The demand for infrastructure financing is huge worldwide, especially since the launch of the Belt and Road initiative, which has made infrastructure financing a key issue attracting attention from both China and abroad. Hong Kong is an International financial centre in Asia and possesses unparalleled strength in the field of infrastructure financing. Last year, in July, the HKMA established the Infrastructure Financing Facilitation Office (IFFO), building a new and unique platform to bring together more than 60 world-class multilateral institutions, asset owners, banks, insurance companies and other financial institutions, as well as the construction and operating parties of infrastructure projects, and various professional institutions, to exchange information, share experience, and seek cooperation opportunities regarding infrastructure investment and financing issues. Since its establishment, IFFO has held more than ten large-scale conferences, seminars and workshops. The HKMA has also signed Memorandums of Understanding with the International Finance Corporation, the Global Infrastructure Hub, the China Development Bank and The Export-Import Bank of China to jointly promote infrastructure investment and financing activities. Although it has not been established for a long time, it has laid a solid foundation for Hong Kong’s future as an infrastructure investment and financing centre.

Removing barriers and deregulation is the only way to enhance competitiveness. Within the year, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority actively participated in and provided support to the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region Government in amending the taxation Ordinance, providing a conducive environment for companies with in-house treasury financing activities operating in Hong Kong. We are also actively reaching out to multinational companies, attracting them to develop or expand their treasury financing activities in Hong Kong, thereby further strengthening the functions of the Hong Kong financial markets.

Last year, the offshore Renminbi market was in a period of adjustment. Affected by market volatility and expectations regarding the exchange rate, the global offshore Renminbi funding pool generally contracted. Despite this, Hong Kong remains the leader in offshore Renminbi business, maintaining the world’s largest Renminbi funding pool, with Renminbi cleared through Hong Kong remaining at a high of approximately RMB860 billion per day. To further improve liquidity arrangements in the Hong Kong offshore Renminbi market, in October last year we increased the number of primary liquidity providing institutions from 7 to 9, bringing the total commitment for bilateral funding from the original RMB140 billion to RMB180 billion, ensuring that the market can continue to operate in an orderly manner even when there is a liquidity crunch in the offshore Renminbi market. The launch of the “Stock Connect” between Shenzhen and Hong Kong in December last year further boosted Hong Kong’s Renminbi business. The HKMA is also working with relevant authorities on the mainland to study the “Bond Connect” scheme, further facilitating participation by investors on both sides in the bond market and enhancing the connection of bond market infrastructure.

Despite last year’s global investment environment being full of various unstable factors, thanks to several defensive deployments taken over the past period, the Exchange Fund recorded HK$68.1 billion in investment income last year. Since 1994, the Exchange Fund has achieved an annual investment return Rate of 4.8%, higher than the local inflation Rate of 2.1% during the same period.

The Exchange Fund will continue to promote diversification of investments, including further expanding asset classes and increasing investment in credit assets, inflation-hedging investment products, and emerging markets. As a flagship of diversified investment, the “Long-Term Growth Portfolio” invests in alternative assets through private equity and real estate projects. Since its launch in 2009, the portfolio has consistently delivered strong performance, with an average annualised internal rate of return of about 12% since its establishment. With a portion of the Government’s “Future Fund” commitments allocated to the portfolio, we have quickened the pace of investment. At the end of last year, the asset scale of the “Long-Term Growth Portfolio” was approximately HK$181.8 billion, with a total amount of HK$133.8 billion granted but not yet drawn down for investment. The Exchange Fund will continue to adhere to the investment strategy of “capital preservation first, long-term appreciation”, seeking long-term stable returns while maintaining ample liquidity and reserve funds.

# 2016年摘要

# 經濟及金融環境

隨着環球經濟及貿易活動疲弱，香港經濟增長回軟。年內本港股市及住宅物業市場波動，置業負擔能力依然偏緊。

儘管環球市場風險及衝擊增加，香港銀行體系仍維持穩健。銀行資本及流動性狀況維持良好；資產質素輕微轉差，但仍處於健康水平。

# 貨幣穩定

儘管面對波動的外圍環境，港元匯率仍然保持穩定，反映聯繫匯率制度承受外來衝擊的能力。

貨幣市場繼續運作暢順，銀行同業流動資金充裕。於12月，繼美國聯邦儲備局決定上調聯邦基金利率目標範圍，香港基本利率上調25基點至1.00厘。

# 銀行體系穩定

金管局加強監管銀行的風險管治架構，以及信用、流動性與科技風險管理。金管局亦採取具體行動，促進普及金融和應對企業在香港開立及維持銀行帳戶遇到的困難。

監管政策方面，就本港實施國際監管及會計標準的準備工作取得重大進展，當中包括《金融機構（處置機制）條例》下的處置框架。

# 香港的國際金融中心地位

香港維持其作為全球離岸人民幣業務樞紐和資產管理中心的地位。稅制獲進一步完善，營造更有利環境，吸引跨國公司在香港設立企業財資中心。

為發展香港成為基建融資中心與金融科技樞紐，金管局成立基建融資促進辦公室及金融科技促進辦公室。金管局順利開始實施儲值支付工具及零售支付系統的監管制度，並批出13個儲值支付工具牌照。

# 儲備管理

儘管投資環境困難，充斥黑天鵝事件，但有賴過去幾年所採取的一連串防禦措施，增強外匯基金的抗震能力，外匯基金錄得2%的整體投資回報。

金管局加快多元化投資的步伐，特別是長期增長組合的投資。

# 機構職能

金管局透過傳媒、公眾教育活動及其他各種渠道與社會和市場保持有效溝通，增進公眾對金管局政策及運作的了解。

金管局繼續加強機構管治，包括推動員工提升專業能力、嚴格控制財政及加強資訊科技保安，以應付推行新措施及日益繁重的工作所帶來的挑戰。

# Highlights of 2016

# economic and financial environment

As global economic and trade activities remain subdued, Hong Kong’s economic growth softens. Within the year, the local stock market and residential property market experienced volatility, and housing affordability remains stretched.

Despite global market risks and increasing shocks, Hong Kong’s banking system remains robust. Banks’ capital and liquidity positions remain good; asset quality worsened with slight signs, but remains at healthy levels.

# Monetary stability

Despite faced with a turbulent external environment, the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate remains stable, reflecting the resilience of the linked exchange rate system to external shocks.

Monetary markets continue to operate smoothly, and banks’ liquidity is ample. In December, following the decision of the uS Federal Reserve to adjusted upwards the Federal Funds Rate target range, the basic interest rate in Hong Kong was adjusted upwards 25 basis points to 1.00.

# Banking system stability

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority is strengthening the supervisory risk governance framework of banks, as well as credit, liquidity and technology risk management. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority also takes concrete action to promote financial inclusion and deal with the difficulties companies encounter in opening and maintaining accounts in Hong Kong.

In terms of supervisory policies, significant progress has been made in preparing for the implementation of International regulatory and accounting standards in Hong Kong, including the resolution framework under the Ordinance on Financial Institutions (resolution mechanism).

# Hong Kong’s International financial centre status

Hong Kong maintains its position as a global hub for offshore renminbi business and asset management centre. The tax system has been further refined, fostering a more conducive environment, attracting multinational companies to establish treasury centres in Hong Kong.

To foster the Development of Hong Kong as an Infrastructure financing centre with a Fintech Hub, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority established the Infrastructure Financing Facilitation office and the Fintech Facilitation office. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority smoothly began implementation of the regulatory regime for stored value payment facilities and retail payment systems, and granted 13 stored value payment licences.

# Reserves Management

Despite the difficult investment environment full of black swan events, thanks to the series of defensive measures taken over the years, the Exchange Fund’s resilience was enhanced, and the Exchange Fund recorded a 2% overall investment return.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority quickens the pace of diversification of investment activities, especially long-term growth portfolios investment.

# Functions of institutions

The HKMA operates through media, public education programmes and other various channels to maintain effective communications with the community and markets, to facilitate public understanding of the HKMA’s policies and operation.

The HKMA continues to strengthen corporate governance, including supporting professional development of staff, instituting rigorous financial discipline and enhancing Fintech security, to help cope with the challenges brought by the implementation of new measures and increasing complexity of work.

# 經濟及金融環境

隨着環球經濟及貿易活動疲弱，香港經濟增長在2016年回軟。面對外圍環境不明朗因素加劇，預期2017年經濟增長仍然溫和。

# 經濟回顧

# 概覽

香港經濟增長在2016年放緩，實質本地生產總值增長由2015年的2.4%降至1.9%（表1）。淨出口是主要拖累，當中訪港旅遊業疲弱令服務輸出受壓（圖1）。本地需求動力亦放緩，但繼續為整體經濟增長提供主要支持。勞工市場大致保持穩定，失業率維持於3.3至3.4%的低位。由於本地成本及外部價格壓力減退，消費物價通脹進一步放緩。面對波動的外圍環境及多變的市場氣氛，資產市場增添起伏。鑑於住宅物業市場再度暢旺，政府於11月實施新印花稅措施。

儘管外圍環境波動及美元利率上升，本港外匯及貨幣市場繼續運作暢順。港元現貨匯率於1月份略為轉弱後一直在7.75附近水平徘徊。年內兌換保證並無被觸發，總結餘與未償還外匯基金票據及債券合計幾乎維持不變，約為1.2萬億港元。繼美國於12月中加息後，金管局基本利率由0.75厘上調至1厘。香港銀行同業拆息及較長期債券收益率維持在相對較低水平，但在接近年底時稍升，部分反映美元相應拆息及收益率的走勢。整體銀行貸款增長在2016年加快至6.5%。雖然整體貸款質素略為轉差，但特定分類貸款比率仍然維持在極低水平。

# 本地需求

本地需求的增長力度在2016年略為減弱。儘管穩定的就業及收入狀況繼續為私人消費帶來支持，但其增速仍降至1.6%，部分反映經濟不明朗因素加劇。政府消費增長亦略為減慢至3.3%。本地固定資本形成總額繼續按季大幅上落（圖2），累計全年收縮0.5%。私營部門機器及設備購置成為主要拖累，在營商前景欠佳下連續第3年收縮，而樓宇及建造活動則因住屋動工項目增加而轉殷。

圖 2 本地需求

# 外部需求

香港出口在接近2016年底時有回穩跡象，但綜合全年表現仍然乏力（圖3）。貨品出口較2015年的低基數上升1.7%。香港對先進經濟體的出口仍然呆滯；但在區內貿易流動轉趨穩定下，香港對中國內地、印度、韓國、新加坡及台灣的出口則較2015年好轉。

部分反映零售銷售在近年急速增長後轉趨正常化，香港服務輸出在2016年顯著收縮3.1%。貨品進口在2015年收縮後於2016年收復部分失地，服務輸入則部分受惠於本地居民外遊意欲而持續增長。2016年整體貿易順差收窄，拖累本地經濟增長。

# 通脹

通脹壓力在2016年仍然受控。剔除政府一次性紓緩措施的影響後，基本通脹率由2015年的2.5%下降至2016年的2.3%（圖4）。在早前新訂私人住宅租金下調所帶來的傳遞效應下，綜合消費物價指數中的租金組成項目通脹回落。受惠於全球商品價格偏軟及港元強勢，進口價格通脹受到遏抑。另一方面，在勞工成本穩定增長及租金成本壓力（尤其零售範疇）有所紓緩下，本地成本壓力保持溫和。

# 勞工市場

勞工市場在2016年大致保持穩定，勞工供求升幅相若。按行業分析，旅遊相關行業的勞工市場狀況轉差，其他行業則大致平穩。整體而言，經季節因素調整失業率由2015年的3.3%稍升至3.4%（圖5）。在勞工市場穩定下，名義工資在首3季上升3.8%，而2015年的升幅為4.6%。首3季實質工資亦上升0.9%，而2015年的升幅為1.5%。

資料來源：政府統計處。

# 股市

香港股市在2016年大幅上落。受到人民幣貶值壓力及內地股市波動所影響，恒生指數於2月份跌至3年來的低位（圖6）。本港股市在3月份跟隨美國及其他主要股市顯著造好而回升。儘管英國脫歐公投觸發市場波動，但在外界預期美國聯邦儲備局會放緩加息步伐及其他主要央行推行貨幣寬鬆政策下，市場氣氛迅速改善。恒生指數於9月份升至24,100點的一年高位。然而，受到美國總統選舉結果及預計美國會加快加息步伐所影響，本港股市在第4季再度受壓。整體而言，恒生指數於2016年微升0.4%，在2015年則下跌7.2%。平均每日成交額由上年的1,056億港元降至669億港元，而本港股市集資總額亦由上年的11,156億港元減少至4,901億港元。

圖 6 資產價格
資料來源：差餉物業估價署及香港交易及結算所有限公司。

# 物業市場

住宅物業市場在2016年略為波動。物業成交量於第1季錄得歷史新低後，在其後數月有所回升，但在11月推出新印花稅措施後再度下挫。整體而言，成交量在2016年稍跌至54,701宗。另一方面，樓價自第2季起上升並超越2015年9月的高位，2016年的累計升幅為7.8%（圖6）。置業負擔能力依然偏緊，樓價與收入比率為15.9，超越1997年的歷史高位；而收入槓桿比率為72.0%，遠高於長期平均水平。2 由於銀行推出具競爭力的按揭計劃，按揭利率稍為回落，於接近年底時則跟隨香港銀行同業拆息上升而略為回升。工商物業市場方面，全年交投大致保持穩定。由於非住宅物業價格較2015年高位回落，相應租金收益率較上年微升，但仍處於低位。

# 經濟前景

# 經濟環境

預期2017年實質本地生產總值增長將保持溫和。政府預測經濟增長幅度介乎2至3%之間，私營機構分析員預測增幅平均為2.0%。外圍方面，隨着環球宏觀經濟及金融環境變得不明朗，全球經濟及貿易增長或會保持溫和；再加上港元實質有效匯率因美元強勢而上升，將會抑制香港的出口表現。本地方面，雖然穩定的就業及收入狀況會支持消費，但受利率上升所拖累，預期私人消費會溫和增長。受惠於住屋供應增加及多個基建項目展開，樓宇及建造活動應會穩步增長，但營商氣氛疲弱及利率趨升將影響商界資本投資。

# 通脹及勞工市場

預計2017年通脹壓力仍然溫和。一方面環球商品價格上漲及中國內地通脹趨升或會令進口價格上升，另一方面港元轉強卻可能會令上述壓力受到遏抑。在溫和的經濟動力下，本地成本壓力仍可受控，但由於新訂住宅租金於2017年初上升，綜合消費物價指數中的租金組成項目通脹可能會稍升。市場共識預測2017年整體通脹率為1.9%，政府預期基本通脹率為2.0%。雖然不明朗因素加劇或會影響招聘意欲，私營機構分析員預計2017年失業率會維持於3.4%。

# 不明朗因素及風險

2017年經濟前景會受制於眾多不明朗因素，當中來自外圍環境的影響尤甚。美國新一屆政府政策的不確定性，將令環球經濟前景變得不明朗，當中可能出現的保護主義政策亦會對全球貿易帶來阻力。英國脫歐進程及歐洲幾個主要國家舉行大選，亦可能導致資產市場波動，並影響港元資金流向。此外，美國利率正常化將會令本地貨幣狀況收緊，並對實質經濟及資產價格構成下調壓力；當中樓市繼續偏緊，市場前景仍然很不明朗。短期而言，按揭息率仍然偏低、就業及收入狀況穩定，以及地產發展商加推優惠（例如折扣及現金回贈）令累積的購買力獲得釋放，均可為住宅需求帶來支持。另一方面，新印花稅措施、美國可能加快加息步伐及房屋供應穩步增長，則可能繼續為樓市帶來阻力。

# 銀行體系表現

儘管本港經濟面對阻力，加上國際政治事件出乎意料的結果令市場波動加劇，香港銀行體系在2016年仍然穩健。認可機構的資本及流動性狀況維持良好，資產質素輕微轉差，但仍處於健康水平。

# 利率走勢

隨着美國利率上升，香港銀行同業拆息在11月及12月顯著上升。反映零售銀行港元資金成本的綜合利率則輕微上升（圖7）。

圖 7 香港銀行同業拆息、綜合利率及最優惠貸款利率

註：
1. 香港銀行同業拆息（每月平均數）由香港銀行公會公布。
2. 最優惠貸款利率（每月平均數）是參考香港上海滙豐銀行有限公司所報利率。

# 盈利走勢

零售銀行在2016年的盈利略為改善，其香港業務的整體除稅前經營溢利增長8.7%。增長主要是由外匯及衍生工具業務收入（+39.7%）、附屬公司派發的股息收入（+123.5%）及淨利息收入（+2.8%）所帶動，不過部份增長被費用及佣金收入減少(-11.3%)所抵銷。零售銀行除稅後溢利錄得44.4%的升幅，增長主要來自非經常項目。零售銀行除稅後平均資產回報率亦相應由2015 年的 1.04% 上升至 1.44%（圖 8）。

圖8 零售銀行的表現

2016年零售銀行淨息差為1.32%，與2015年的水平相同（圖9）。雖然零售銀行繼續將剩餘資金配置於息率較低而流動性較高的金融投資，但利息收益的減少被利息成本下降所抵銷。

圖9 零售銀行淨息差

零售銀行非利息收入佔總經營收入的比例為44.3%，大致維持穩定。雖然費用與佣金收入下跌11.3%，但股息收入及外匯與衍生工具業務收入分別上升123.5%及39.7%。

# economic and financial environment

As global economic and trade activities remained subdued, Hong Kong’s economic growth softened in 2016. Faced with increased external environment uncertainty, 2017 economic growth is expected to remain moderate.

# Economic Review

# Overview

Hong Kong’s economic growth slowed in 2016, with real Gross Domestic Product growth declining from 2.4% in 2015 to 1.9% (Chart 1). Net exports were the main drag, with the subdued performance of inbound tourism weighing down exports of services (Figure 1). Domestic demand also moderated, but continued to provide primary support for overall economic growth. The labour market remained broadly stable, with the unemployment rate maintaining a low level of 3.3% to 3.4%. Due to the easing of local costs and external prices pressures, consumer price inflation further slowed. Faced with a volatile external environment and shifting market sentiments, asset markets experienced increased fluctuations. In the light of a renewed boom in the residential property market, the Government implemented new stamp duty measures in November.

Despite turbulent external environments and rising US interest rates, the local foreign exchange and monetary market continued to operate smoothly. The Hong Kong dollar spot exchange rate hovered around the 7.75 level after a slight deterioration in January. The exchange guarantee was not triggered throughout the year, and the combined total of the Exchange Fund’s outstanding Bills and Notes and bonds remained almost unchanged, at approximately HK$1.2 trillion. Following the US Federal Reserve’s rate hike in mid-December, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority’s base rate was adjusted upwards from 0.75% to 1%. Hong Kong interbank offered Rates (HIBORs) and longer-term bond yields remained at relatively low levels, but rose slightly towards the end of the year, partly reflecting the movements of corresponding US HIBORs and yields. Overall bank lending growth accelerated to 6.5% in 2016. Although overall loan quality weakened slightly, the ratio of classified loans remained at extremely low levels.

Figure 1 Contribution to the growth of real local gross domestic product by sector
Source: Census and Statistics Department.

Chart 1: Real domestic gross product growth by expenditure item (compared to the previous period)

Note: The quarterly change in the total amount of fixed capital formation, seasonally adjusted, is not detailed.
Sources of information: Census and Statistics Department.

# local demand

Local demand grew at a slightly weaker pace in 2016. Despite maintaining... stability in employment and income conditions continuing to provide full support for private consumption, its growth slowed to 1.6%, partly reflecting increased economic uncertainty. Government consumption growth also slowed slightly to 3.3%. Local fixed capital formation continued to fluctuate markedly on a quarterly basis (Chart 2), with a cumulative contraction of 0.5% for the whole year. Purchases of plant and equipment by the private sector became a major drag, contracting for the third consecutive year amid poor business prospects, while building and construction activity turned buoyant due to increased housing project implementation.

Figure 2 local demand
Source: Census and Statistics Department.

# external demand

Hong Kong exports showed signs of stabilising towards the end of 2016, but the overall performance for the whole year remained weak (Chart 3). Merchandise exports rose by 1.7% compared to the low base of 2015. Hong Kong’s exports to advanced economies remained sluggish; however, with trade fund flows in the region becoming more stable, Hong Kong’s exports to mainland China, India, South Korea, Singapore and Taiwan improved compared to 2015.

Partly reflecting the retail sales normalisation process after growing rapidly over the years, Hong Kong exports of services shrank significantly by 3.1% in 2016. Merchandise imports recouped some ground in 2016 after contracting in 2015, while imports of services continued to grow, partly benefiting from local residents’ willingness to travel abroad. The overall trade surplus narrowed in 2016, weighing down domestic economic growth.

Figure 3 Goods exports and exports of services
Source: Census and Statistics Department.

# Inflation

Inflationary stress remained contained in 2016. After removing the effect of the Government’s one-time relief measures, the basic rate of inflation decreased from 2.5% in 2015 to 2.3% in 2016 (Chart 4). The rental component in the Composite Consumer Price Index saw a drop in inflation brought about by the downward adjustment in newly-leased private residential rental. Benefiting from soft global commodity prices and a strong Hong Kong dollar, imported price inflation was suppressed. On the other hand, with stable growth in labour costs and eased rental cost stress (particularly in the retail sector), local cost pressures remained moderate.

Figure 4 Basic Consumer Price Inflation
Source: Census and Statistics Department.

# labour markets

The labour market remained largely stable in 2016, with the increase in labour supply and demand at a similar pace. According to industry analyses, the labour market conditions of the tourism-related industry deteriorated, while other industries remained generally stable. Overall, the seasonally adjusted unemployment Rate rose from 3.3% in 2015 to 3.4% (Chart 5). With banking stability in the labour market, labour earnings in nominal terms increased by 3.8% in the first three quarters, while the increase in 2015 was 4.6%. Real labour earnings also increased by 0.9% in the first three quarters, while the increase in 2015 was 1.5%.

Figure 5 Labour market conditions
Source: Census and Statistics Department.

# stock market

The Hong Kong stock market fluctuated markedly in 2016. Affected by the pressure of Renminbi depreciation and turbulence in the mainland China stock market, the Hang Seng Index fell to a three-year low in February (Figure 6). The Hong Kong stock market recovered in March, following solid gains in the US and other major markets. Despite the Brexit referendum triggering market volatility, market sentiments quickly improved as the Federal Reserve was expected to slow the pace of interest rate hikes and other major central banks implemented loose monetary policies. The Hang Seng Index rose to a year-high of 24,100 points in September. However, affected by the outcome of the US presidential election and the expectation that the US would quicken the pace of interest rate hikes, the Hong Kong stock market came under pressure again in the fourth quarter. Overall, the Hang Seng Index saw a slight increase of 0.4% in 2016, while it declined by 7.2% in 2015. The average daily turnover decreased from HK$105.6 billion in the previous year to HK$66.9 billion, and the total amount of capital raised by the Hong Kong stock market also decreased from HK$111.56 billion in the previous year to HK$49.01 billion.

Figure 6 asset prices
Source of information: Rating and Valuation Department and Hong Kong Exchanges and Clearing Limited.

# property markets

The residential property market experienced slight volatility in 2016. Property turnover recorded a record low in the first quarter before recovering somewhat in the subsequent months, but fell sharply again after the introduction of new stamp duty measures in November. Overall, turnover decreased slightly to 54,701 items in 2016. On the other hand, prices rose since the second quarter and exceeded the peak of September 2015, with a cumulative increase of 7.8% in 2016 (Figure 6). Housing affordability remains stretched, with the price-to-income ratio at 15.9, exceeding the historical high in 1997; and the income leverage ratio at 72.0%, significantly higher than the long-term average. Due to banks launching competitive mortgage schemes, mortgage rates fell slightly, then experienced a slight increase towards the end of the year following the rise in Hong Kong interbank offered Rates (HIBORs). Regarding the commercial property market, overall trading remained stable throughout the year. As non-residential property prices fell from their 2015 high, corresponding rental yields increased slightly compared to the previous year, but remained at a low level.

# Economic outlook

# Economic environment

The forecast for real local gross domestic product growth in 2017 is expected to remain moderate. The Government predicts economic growth of between 2% and 3%, while private sector analysts forecast an average growth rate of 2.0%. Externally, as the global macroeconomic and financial environment becomes uncertain, global economic and trade growth may remain moderate; coupled with the rise in the Hong Kong dollar’s effective exchange rate due to a strong US dollar, this will suppress Hong Kong’s export performance. Locally, although stable employment and income conditions will support consumption, private consumption is expected to grow steadily, weighed down by rising interest rates. Benefiting from increased housing supply and the commencement of a number of infrastructure projects, building and construction activity should steadily increase, but a subdued business environment and increased interest rates will affect business capital investment.

# Inflation and labour markets

It is forecast that inflationary pressures will remain mild in 2017. On one hand, rising global commodity prices and increased (trend upward) in Mainland China’s inflation could lead to an increase in import prices; on the other hand, the strengthening of the Hong Kong dollar may contain the aforementioned pressures. With moderate economic momentum, local cost pressures remain contained, but due to the rise in new residential rental at the beginning of 2017, the inflation of the rental component in the Composite Consumer Price Index may pick-up in slightly. Market consensus predicts an overall inflation rate of 1.9% for 2017, and the Government expects a basic inflation rate of 2.0%. Although heightened uncertainties may affect hiring intentions, private sector analysts forecast that the unemployment rate will maintain at 3.4% in 2017.

# Uncertainties and risks

In 2017, the economic outlook will be subject to numerous uncertainties, particularly from external factors. The uncertainty surrounding the new US administration’s policies will lead to a more uncertain global economic outlook, and potential protectionist policies could also bring resistance to global trade. The Brexit process and elections in several major European countries may also lead to asset market volatility and affect Hong Kong dollar fund flows. Furthermore, US interest rate normalisation will tighten local monetary conditions and put downward adjustment pressure on the real economy and asset prices; among them, the property market remains stretched, and the market outlook remains highly uncertain. In the short term, low mortgage rates, stable employment and income conditions, and developers offering incentives (such as discounts and cash rebates) releasing accumulated purchasing power can all provide support for residential demand. On the other hand, new stamp duty measures, the potential for the US to quicken the pace of interest rate hikes, and steadily increasing housing supply may continue to bring resistance to the property market.

# Banks’ performance

Despite the Hong Kong economy faced with headwinds, coupled with unexpected outcomes from International political events causing increased market volatility, Hong Kong’s banking system remained sound in 2016. Authorised institutions’ capital and liquidity positions maintain good levels, asset quality slightly deteriorated, but remains at a healthy level.

# Interest rate trends

With the US interest rates rising, Hong Kong interbank offered Rates (HIBORs) increased significantly in November and December. The composite interest rate reflecting the Hong Kong dollar funding costs of retail banks rose slightly (Figure 7).

Figure 7 Hong Kong interbank offered Rates (HIBORs), comprehensive interest rates and best lending rates.

Note:
1. Hong Kong Interbank Offered Rates (HIBORs) (monthly average) are announced by the Hong Kong Association of Banks.
2. The best lending rate (monthly average) is referenced to the rate reported by Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited.

# Profit trends

Retail banking’s profit for 2016 improved slightly, with its Hong Kong business’s overall profit before tax growing by 8.7%. The growth was mainly driven by income from exchange and derivatives business (+39.7%), dividend income from subsidiaries (+123.5%) and net interest (+2.8%), although part of the growth was offset by a decrease in fee and commission income (-11.3%). Profit after tax for retail banking recorded an increase of 44.4%, with growth mainly coming from non-recurring items. The annualised rate of return on average assets for retail banking also rose to 1.44% from 1.04% in 2015 (Chart 8).

Figure 8 retail banks’ performance

In 2016, the net interest rate for retail banks was 1.32%, the same level as in 2015 (Chart 9). Although retail banks continued to allocate remaining funds to financial investments with lower interest rates and higher liquidity, the decrease in interest income was offset by a decline in interest costs.

Figure 9 Retail banking net interest margin

Retail banking non-interest income accounted for 44.3% of total business income, remaining largely stable. Although fee and commission income fell by 11.3%, dividend income and exchange and derivatives business income rose by 123.5% and 39.7% respectively.

# 貨幣穩定

儘管外圍環境波動及美元息率上升，港元匯率在2016年仍然保持穩定。香港貨幣市場亦繼續運作暢順，銀行同業流動資金充裕。聯繫匯率制度繼續展現高度承受衝擊的能力，是香港貨幣及金融穩定的基石。

# 目標

香港貨幣政策的主要目標是維持貨幣穩定，即確保港元匯價穩定，使港元在外匯市場兌美元的匯率保持在7.75至7.85港元兌1美元的區間內。該貨幣體制主要採用貨幣發行局制度，規定由外匯基金所持的美元儲備向貨幣基礎提供最少百分之百的支持；貨幣基礎若有變動，美元儲備亦必須作出相應增減，與貨幣基礎的變動百分之百配合。

貨幣基礎（表1）包括：
- 負債證明書（為3間發鈔銀行發行的銀行紙幣提供十足支持）
- 政府發行的流通紙幣及硬幣
- 銀行在金管局所持結算戶口的結餘總額（即總結餘）
- 金管局代表政府發行的外匯基金票據及債券。

表1 貨幣基礎

金管局透過自動利率調節機制及履行兌換保證的堅決承諾來維持港元匯率的穩定。若市場對港元的需求大過供應，令市場匯率轉強至7.75港元兌1美元的強方兌換保證匯率，金管局會向銀行沽出港元、買入美元，使總結餘增加及港元利率下跌，從而令港元匯率從強方兌換保證匯率水平回復至7.75到7.85的兌換範圍內。相反，若港元供過於求，令市場匯率轉弱至7.85港元兌1美元的弱方兌換保證匯率，金管局會向銀行買入港元，使總結餘減少及推高港元利率，港元匯率隨之由弱方兌換保證匯率水平回復至兌換範圍內。

# 2016年回顧

# 匯率穩定

港元匯率在2016年首兩個月略有波動後，於年內餘下時間一直窄幅徘徊。港元在2016年初兌美元顯著轉弱，由1月4日的7.7510降至1月20日的7.8196（圖1）。港元匯率轉弱符合聯繫匯率制度的正常運作，反映美國在2015年12月加息後港元與美元的負息差擴濶。此外，其他市場相關因素，包括香港股市出現拋售、內地及香港經濟前景不及以前樂觀、人民幣匯率波動增加，以及亞洲貨幣普遍疲弱，均導致港元需求減弱。受到市場氣氛改善支持，港元匯率在2月略為轉強，並自3月起一直在7.753至7.776之間窄幅徘徊，即使英國脫歐公投及美國總統選舉引發市場波動亦未受影響。由於市場預期美國會在夏季加息，港元匯率於5月出現短暫的轉弱壓力。整體而言，港元外匯市場在2016年一直正常運作。

圖 1 2016年市場匯率

由於兌換保證沒有被觸發，因此總結餘及未償還外匯基金票據及債券總額在2016年沒有明顯變動，大致維持在12,222億港元左右（圖2）。年內金管局增發總值1,320億港元的外匯基金票據，以滿足銀行在流動性管理方面的龐大需求，令總結餘相應減少至2016年底的2,596億港元。增發外匯基金票據符合貨幣發行局制度的原則，這是由於增發外匯基金票據只屬貨幣基礎組成部分之間的轉移，即由總結餘移至未償還外匯基金票據及債券，貨幣基礎仍然由外匯儲備提供十足支持。

圖 2 2016年總結餘及未償還外匯基金票據及債券

# 貨幣市場

香港銀行同業拆息在2016年大部分時間維持在較低水平（圖3）。香港銀行同業拆息在1、2月期間因金融市場波動加劇而面對一些上升壓力，但在3月隨着金融環境回復平靜而轉趨穩定。於第2及第3季，儘管市場關注英國脫歐公投結果以及美國貨幣市場基金改革，香港銀行同業拆息仍大致保持穩定。部分受到年底資金需求影響，以及港元拆息追回美元拆息的升幅，香港銀行同業拆息在第4季錄得較大升幅。儘管如此，短期銀行同業拆息在2016年大致維持在低於基本利率的水平。

因應美國聯邦基金利率目標範圍於12月14日（美國時間）由0.25至0.50厘上調至0.50至0.75厘，基本利率於12月15日由0.75厘上調至1.00厘。基本利率的調整是按照於2009年3月26日宣布的經修訂計算公式作出。按照該公式，基本利率定於美國聯邦基金利率目標範圍下限加50基點的水平，或隔夜與1個月香港銀行同業拆息的5天移動平均數的平均值水平，兩者以較高者為準。

圖 3 2016年香港銀行同業拆息

港元遠期匯率點子在1月出現大幅溢價，大致跟隨港元與美元息差的走勢，以及部分反映投資者為其港股組合作出外匯對沖的需求（圖4）。遠期匯率溢價在2月開始收窄。隨着市況轉趨穩定，港元遠期匯率點子在3至11月期間大致保持穩定，其後在12月因港元與美元息差收窄而再度上升。整體而言，香港貨幣市場運作暢順，銀行同業流動資金充裕。貼現窗借貸在2016年並不活躍，僅涉及53億港元。

# 聯繫匯率制度

儘管經歷多次區內以至全球金融危機，聯繫匯率制度（聯匯制度）過去數十年來一直是香港貨幣及金融穩定的基石。2016年初市場波動加劇，再度引起有關港元轉弱及情況有如亞洲金融危機時期的評論。為增進各界對聯匯制度的認識，金管局向公眾闡釋聯匯制度的技術細節，並指出香港金融體系有能力抵禦衝擊。政府亦重申堅決維持聯匯制度。外匯及貨幣市場穩定，進一步鞏固公眾對政府維持聯匯制度的決心以及港元作為支付及保值貨幣的信心。國際貨幣基金組織在與香港進行年度第四條磋商時，明確表示聯匯制度是最適合香港的貨幣制度，指出香港靈活的經濟結構、充裕的財政及儲備緩衝、以及穩健有效的金融監管是聯匯制度的後盾。

圖 4 2016年美元兌港元遠期匯率點子

鑑於穩健的銀行體系對聯匯制度的正常運作具關鍵作用，金管局繼續密切監察銀行的信用、流動性及利率風險管理以及壓力測試結果，並加強對銀行個人、企業及內地相關貸款的監管，以確保銀行體系具備應付衝擊的能力。面對美國貨幣政策正常化，香港銀行同業拆息開始上升，金管局提醒市民保持警覺，並作好準備以應付可能出現的市場波動及風險。

為提高貨幣發行局帳目的透明度，自1998年10月起，外匯基金已有部分資產被指定用作支持貨幣基礎。支持比率（即支持資產相對貨幣基礎的比率）於2016年在106.3至107.5%之間的窄幅上落，並無觸及上限或下限。該比率於2016年12月31日為106.7%（圖5）。在聯匯制度下，雖然已指定某些外匯基金資產作為支持組合，但外匯基金的全部資產均可用作支持港元匯率。外匯基金的龐大財政資源，能在面對突如其來的衝擊時為香港貨幣及金融穩定提供強力後盾。

圖5 2016年支持比率每日變動

# 研究工作

外匯基金諮詢委員會轄下的貨幣發行委員會負責監察和探討與香港貨幣及金融穩定有關的課題。在2016年，貨幣發行委員會探討的課題包括香港與中國內地及美國經濟增長同步性、港元貨幣外部需求及香港的金融狀況指數。貨幣發行委員會會議紀錄及金管局向其呈交的貨幣發行局制度運作報告，均載於金管局網站。

香港金融研究中心繼續支持貨幣政策、銀行業及金融範疇的研究工作。在2016年，研究中心合共邀請18位學者到訪，並發表20份工作論文。

年內研究中心舉辦6項國際會議及研討會，主要包括：
- 於1月舉辦「第7屆中國經濟年度國際研討會」，主題為「中國對全球經濟的影響日益加深」，其間發表8份涵蓋廣泛議題的研究論文，包括中國增長再平衡及增長潛力、來自中國的經濟外溢效應、人民幣對全球及區內的影響，以及人民幣市場之間的利差交易走勢及資訊流動。
- 於3月與香港科技大學及慶應大學合辦「科技大學與慶應大學及研究中心匯率及宏觀經濟研討會」，內容涵蓋多個不同經濟議題，包括全球經濟失衡、匯率動態變化、資本管制及貨幣政策。
- 於8月與香港城市大學合辦「房地產與金融穩定研討會」，會上發表的論文內容涵蓋年齡、人口與住屋需求；大額投資者對資產質素的影響；香港房屋價格動態變動；住屋市場負擔能力；按揭規例對家庭生命周期置業決定的影響，以及中國內地的住宅物業市場。
- 於10月與金管局及國際結算銀行合辦有關亞太區經濟體系的研討會，主題為「在動盪不穩的全球環境下區內經濟體系的抗震能力」。研討會吸引多間央行的高層、主要學者及來自國際組織與私人機構的專家出席，就亞太區經濟體系最迫切的事項進行互動式圓桌討論，交流意見。探討的議題涵蓋廣泛，包括亞洲的金融失衡狀況、資金流、內地經濟放緩對區內其他地方的外溢效應，以及亞洲潛在增長受到的影響及前景。

研究中心亦於8月舉辦「第14屆年度夏季研討會」，並於9月舉辦「第14屆中國內地經濟研討會」，探討內地銀行的資產質素及金融穩定事項。上述會議及研討會吸引學術界、金融服務界及各地央行代表參加。研究中心亦於年內舉辦21場公開小型研討會，探討廣泛的經濟、貨幣及金融議題。

# 紙幣及硬幣

截至2016年底，流通銀行紙幣（指發鈔銀行發行的紙幣）總值4,078億港元，較上年增加13.2%（圖6、7及8）。政府發行的流通紙幣及硬幣總值118億港元，較上年增加5.3%（圖9及10）。在政府發行的紙幣及硬幣中，10港元流通紙幣總值44億港元，當中塑質鈔票佔86%。

# Monetary stability

Despite external volatility and rising US dollar interest rates, the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate remained stable in 2016. Hong Kong’s money market also continued to operate smoothly, with ample interbank liquidity. The linked exchange rate system continues to demonstrate a high resilience to shocks, and is the cornerstone of Hong Kong’s monetary and financial stability.

# target

The primary target of Hong Kong’s monetary policy is to maintain Monetary stability, that is, to ensure exchange rate stability of the Hong Kong dollar, so that the exchange rates of the Hong Kong dollar to the US dollar in the foreign exchange markets are maintained within the range of 7.75 to 7.85 Hong Kong dollars to 1 US dollar. This monetary system mainly adopts a currency issuance System, stipulating that the US dollar Reserves held by the Exchange Fund provide at least 100 percent support to the Monetary Base; if there are changes in the Monetary Base, the US dollar Reserves must also be increased or decreased accordingly, fully matching the percentage change in the Monetary Base.

Monetary Base (Chart 1) includes:
- Liability certificates (providing full support for banknotes issued by three banks)
- Government-issued circulating banknotes and coins
- The aggregate balance of clearing accounts held by banks with the Monetary Authority (i.e., aggregate balance)
- Exchange Fund Bills and Notes issued by the Monetary Authority on behalf of the Government.

Chart 1 Monetary Base

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority maintains the stability of the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate through the automatic interest rate adjustment System and its firm commitment to honour the exchange guarantee. If market demand for the Hong Kong dollar exceeds supply, causing the market exchange rate to strengthen to the strong-side convertibility guarantee rate of 7.75 Hong Kong dollars to 1 US dollar, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority will sell Hong Kong dollars and buy US dollars from banks, increasing the aggregate balance and decreasing Hong Kong dollar interest rates, thereby causing the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate to return from the strong-side convertibility guarantee rate levels to the exchange range of 7.75 to 7.85. Conversely, if the supply of Hong Kong dollars is greater than demand, causing the market exchange rate to weaken to the weak-side convertibility guarantee rate of 7.85 Hong Kong dollars to 1 US dollar, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority will buy Hong Kong dollars from banks, decreasing the aggregate balance and increasing Hong Kong dollar interest rates, and the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate will then return from the weak-side convertibility guarantee rate levels to within the exchange range.

# 2016 in 2016 Review

# Exchange rate stability

The Hong Kong dollar exchange rate experienced slight volatility in the first two months of 2016, after which it fluctuated narrowly for the remainder of the year. The Hong Kong dollar weakened significantly against the US dollar at the beginning of 2016, falling from 7.7510 on January 4 to 7.8196 on January 20 (Figure 1). This weakening of the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate is consistent with the normal operation of the linked exchange rate system, reflecting the widening interest rate differential between Hong Kong and the US after the US Federal Reserve raised interest rates in December 2015. In addition, other market-related factors, including a sell-off in the Hong Kong stock market, less optimistic prospects for the economies of both the Mainland and Hong Kong, increased volatility in the Renminbi exchange rate, and overall weakness in Asian currencies, all contributed to reduced demand for the Hong Kong dollar. Supported by improved market sentiment, the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate strengthened slightly in February and has since fluctuated narrowly between 7.753 and 7.776 from March onwards, even remaining unaffected by the market volatility triggered by the UK Brexit referendum and the US presidential election. Due to market expectations that the US would raise interest rates in the summer, the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate experienced brief downward stress in May. Overall, the Hong Kong foreign exchange market operated normally throughout 2016.

Figure 1 2016 markets exchange rates

As the exchange guarantee was not triggered, the total balance and total amount of outstanding exchange fund Bills and Notes remained largely unchanged in 2016, staying at around HK$12,222 billion (Chart 2). Throughout the year, the HKMA issued exchange fund Bills with a total value of HK$132 billion to meet the substantial demand from banks for liquidity management, causing the total balance to decrease to HK$259.6 billion at the end of 2016. The issuance of exchange fund Bills conforms to the Principles of the currency board system, as the issuance of exchange fund Bills is merely a transfer within the Monetary Base components, i.e., from the total balance to outstanding exchange fund Bills & Notes, and the Monetary Base remains fully backed by foreign exchange reserves.

Figure 2 2016 aggregate balance and outstanding exchange fund(s) Bills & Notes

# Monetary markets

Hong Kong interbank interest rates remained at low levels for most of 2016 (Chart 3). Hong Kong interbank interest rates faced some upward stress in January and February due to increased financial market volatility, but turned stable in March as the financial environment regained calm. In the second and third quarters, despite market attention on the Brexit referendum outcome and US money market Fund reforms, Hong Kong interbank interest rates remained largely stable. Partly subject to year-end funding demand, and also the increase of Hong Kong dollar HIBORs catching up with US dollar interest rates, Hong Kong interbank interest rates recorded a significant increase in the fourth quarter. Despite this, short-term interbank interest rates largely maintained levels below the basic interest rate in 2016.

In accordance with the adjustment of the Federal Fund Rate target range in the US on December 14 (US time) from 0.25 to 0.50 to 0.50 to 0.75, the basic rate was adjusted upwards from 0.75 to 1.00 on December 15. The adjustment of the basic rate was made according to the revised calculation formula announced on March 26, 2009. According to the formula, the basic rate is set at the lower... bound of the US Federal Fund Rate target range plus 50 basis points, or the average of the 5-day moving average of overnight and 1-month Hong Kong interbank offered Rates (HIBORs), whichever is higher.

Figure 3 2016 Hong Kong interbank offered Rates (HIBORs)

Hong Kong dollar forward exchange rates showed markedly premiums in January, largely following the movements of the Hong Kong dollar versus US dollar interest rate difference, as well as partially reflecting investors’ demand for foreign exchange hedging for their Hong Kong stock portfolios (Figure 4). Forward exchange rate premiums began to shrink in February. As market sentiments turned towards stability, Hong Kong dollar forward exchange rate points remained largely stable from March to November, before rising again in December due to the contraction of the Hong Kong dollar versus US dollar interest rate difference. Overall, Hong Kong’s Monetary market operates smoothly, with ample interbank liquidity funds. Discount window lending was not active in 2016, involving only HK$5.3 billion.

# Linked exchange rate system

Despite experiencing multiple regional and even global financial shocks over the past few decades, the linked exchange rate system has been the cornerstone of monetary and financial stability in Hong Kong. In early 2016, market volatility intensified, once again sparking commentary about a potential weakening of the Hong Kong dollar and comparisons to the Asian financial crisis. To facilitate greater understanding of the linked exchange rate system, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority explained the technical details to the public and pointed out that Hong Kong’s financial system has the resilience to withstand impacts. The Government also reaffirmed its firm commitment to maintaining the linked exchange rate system. Stability in the exchange and monetary markets further consolidated public confidence in the Government’s determination to maintain the linked exchange rate system and the Hong Kong dollar as a currency for payment and preserving value. The International Monetary Fund, during its annual Fourth Article consultation with Hong Kong, explicitly stated that the linked exchange rate system is best suited to Hong Kong’s monetary regime, noting that Hong Kong’s flexible economic structure, ample fiscal and reserves Buffer, and sound and effective financial supervision are the backing of the linked exchange rate system.

Figure 4 2016 US dollar to Hong Kong dollar forward exchange rates

In the light of a sound banking system’s key role in the normal operation of the linked exchange rate system, the HKMA continues to closely monitor banks’ credit, liquidity and interest rate risk management as well as stress test outcome, and strengthens supervision of banks’ personal, corporate and mainland-related loans, to ensure the banking system possesses the ability to address shocks. Faced with the US monetary policy normalisation process, Hong Kong interbank interest rates have begun to rise. The HKMA reminds members of the public to stay vigilant and be well-prepared to meet potential market volatility and risks.

To enhance the transparency of the Exchange Fund’s accounts, since October 1998, part of the Exchange Fund’s assets have been designated to provide support for the monetary base. The backing ratio (i.e., the ratio of backing assets to the monetary base) fluctuated narrowly between 106.3% and 107.5% in 2016, without triggering the upper or lower limit. The ratio was 106.7% on December 31, 2016 (Figure 5). Under the linked exchange rate system, although certain Exchange Fund assets have been designated as backing the portfolio, all of the Exchange Fund’s assets can be used to support the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate. The Exchange Fund’s substantial financial resources can provide strong backing for Hong Kong’s currency and financial stability in the face of sudden shocks.

Figure 5 2016 support ratios daily change.

# research work

The Exchange Fund Advisory Committee’s Currency Issuance Committee monitors and examines subjects related to Hong Kong’s currency and financial stability. In 2016, the subjects examined by the Currency Issuance Committee included the synchronicity of Hong Kong’s economic growth with that of China and the US, external demand for the Hong Kong dollar, and the financial Index conditions in Hong Kong. Records of the Currency Issuance Committee meetings and the monetary authority’s reports on the operation of the currency issuing system are all available on the HKMA website.

Hong Kong Financial Research Centre continues to support Monetary policy, the banking sector and financial research work. In 2016, the research centre collectively invited eighteen research fellows for visits and releases 20 working papers.

This year, the research center organized six international conferences and seminars, primarily including:
- In January, it hosted the “7th China Economic Annual International Seminar,” with the theme “China’s Increasing Influence on the Global Economy.” During the seminar, eight research papers covering a wide range of issues were published, including China’s rebalancing and growth potential, economic spillovers from China, the impact of the Renminbi on the global and regional areas, and the trends and information flows of currency differentials.
- In March, it jointly organized the “University and Keio University Exchange Rate and Macroeconomic Seminar” with Hong Kong University of Science and Technology and Keio University, with content covering a number of different economic issues, including global economic imbalances, exchange rate dynamics, capital controls, and monetary policy.
- In August, it co-organized the “Real Estate and Financial Stability Seminar” with City University of Hong Kong. The papers presented at the seminar covered age, population, and housing demand; the impact of large investors on asset quality; movements in Hong Kong housing prices; housing affordability; the impact of mortgage regulations on housing decisions throughout the family life cycle; and the residential property market in mainland China.
- In October, it jointly organized a seminar on the economic system of the Asia-Pacific region with the HKMA and the Bank for International Settlements, themed “Resilience of Regional Economic Systems in a Turbulent Global Environment.” The seminar attracted senior executives from a number of central banks, leading academics, and experts from international organizations and private institutions to engage in interactive roundtable discussions and share feedback on the most pressing issues facing the Asia-Pacific economic system. The discussed issues covered a wide range, including financial imbalances in Asia, capital flows, the spillover effects of China’s economic slowdown on other parts of the region, and the impact and prospects for potential growth in Asia.

The research Centre also organised the “14th Annual Summer Conference” in August, and held the “14th China Real Economy Conference” in September, to examine the asset quality of mainland banks and matters of financial stability. The above conferences and seminars attracted participants from academia, the financial services sector, and central banks from various regions. The research Centre also held 21 open small-scale workshops throughout the year, to discuss a wide range of economic, monetary and financial issues.

# Banknotes and coins

As of the end of 2016, the total value of banknotes in circulation issued by banks was 407.8 billion Hong Kong dollars, increased by 13.2% compared to a year earlier (Chart 6, 7 and 8). The total value of banknotes and coins issued by the Government in circulation was 11.8 billion Hong Kong dollars, increased by 5.3% compared to a year earlier (Chart 9 and 10). Among the banknotes and coins issued by the Government, the total value of 10 Hong Kong dollar banknotes was 4.4 billion Hong Kong dollars, of them polymer banknotes accounted for 86%.

# 銀行體系穩定

儘管環球市場風險及震盪增加，香港銀行體系在2016年仍維持穩健。金管局在年內加強監管認可機構的風險管治架構，以及信用與流動性風險管理系統的成效。鑑於網絡攻擊日趨頻繁，金管局亦加強監管認可機構的科技風險管理。為貫徹金管局致力打擊金融罪行的目標，認可機構打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集監控措施的成效，繼續是金管局的監管重點。在監管認可機構的操守方面，金管局採取實質行動，推動以客為本的企業文化及促進普及金融，和應對海外中小企及初創企業在香港開立及維持銀行帳戶方面遇到的困難。金管局亦加強監管認可機構銷售投資及保險產品的手法，以進一步提升對客戶的保障。

在監管政策方面，金管局就香港實施國際監管及會計標準的準備工作取得重大進展；當中包括穩定資金淨額比率、大額風險承擔限額、國際財務報告準則第9號及《金融機構（處置機制）條例》下的處置框架。

# 2016年回顧

# 監管工作概覽

金管局在2016年共進行188次非現場審查，涵蓋範圍廣泛，包括認可機構的CAMEL評級、企業管治、業務運作及風險管理。金管局加強與認可機構董事局的聯繫，以強化銀行業的風險管治及企業文化。除與董事局或董事局委員會舉行會議外，亦另行與獨立非執行董事（獨立非執董）會面，就企業文化及風險管治事宜交換意見。金管局亦與認可機構及其外聘審計師舉行三方聯席會議。此外，金管局就認可機構的薪酬制度是否有助促進有效的風險管理進行評估。

在資本充足水平方面，金管局審視認可機構的資本計劃，包括其未來數年的資本目標，以便就2019年全面實施《巴塞爾協定三》緩衝資本作好準備。認可機構的償付能力壓力測試亦因應當前宏觀經濟環境作出改進。金管局又審慎評估各主要零售銀行的恢復計劃，並就需要改善的環節提出意見。

除了非現場審查工作外，金管局繼續以專題評估配合定期現場審查，而專題評估主要適用於被評定為較高風險的範疇。這種監管方法讓金管局更有效地調配監管資源，以應對認可機構所面對的各項新增及主要風險。金管局在2016年共進行377次現場審查及專題評估。這些審查與評估的重點仍是信用風險管理與監控，尤其涉及內地相關業務的信用風險；另一個重點是打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集監控措施。金管局又增加對流動性風險、業務操作風險及科技風險管理的現場審查及專題評估次數。年內專項審查小組亦對認可機構的證券、投資產品、保險及強制性公積金（強積金）相關業務進行現場審查。

表1載有金管局於2016年的監管工作概要。

# 信用風險的監管

# 信貸增長及資產質素

銀行貸款在2016年增長溫和。未償還貸款總額全年增加6.5%；2015年的增幅則為3.5%（表2）。由於客戶存款的增幅超過銀行貸款的增幅，整體貸存比率由2015年底的70.1%降至2016年底的68.4%。

表 2 貸款及墊款的增長

內地相關貸款總額在2016年底增加7%至35,640億港元（表3），其中包括在香港註冊的銀行設於內地的附屬公司入帳的5,450億港元貸款。

銀行業的資產質素在2016年維持穩健。儘管零售銀行的特定分類貸款比率由2015年底的0.69%微升至2016年底的0.72%，但仍遠低於2000年以來的長期平均水平2.4%。同期，整體銀行業的特定分類貸款比率由0.73%上升至0.85%。年內銀行業的內地相關貸款的資產質素呈相若走勢；同期，零售銀行這些貸款的特定分類貸款比率由0.78%微升至0.82%，整體銀行業的相關比率亦由一年前的0.77%微升至0.80%。

金管局投入大量監管資源，以確保認可機構繼續採用審慎的信貸審批標準，並維持有效的貸款分類及撥備制度。金管局在監管過程中亦特別關注認可機構對中國內地民營企業的風險承擔持續增加，以及為增加收益而投資於債務證券所引起的信用風險。此外，金管局就認可機構分銷高風險投資產品的信用風險管理進行專題評估。

# 物業按揭貸款

金管局繼續密切留意認可機構的物業貸款業務。住宅物業價格於2015年9月開始出現調整，但其後於2016年3月再度上升，全年上升8%。新造住宅物業按揭貸款的平均按揭成數，由2009年9月金管局尚未推出首輪物業貸款逆周期措施時的64%，降至2016年12月的51%。新造住宅物業按揭貸款的平均供款與入息比率亦由2010年8月首度推出供款與入息比率上限時的41%，降至2016年12月的34%（圖1）。

圖 1 新造住宅物業按揭貸款的平均按揭成數及供款與入息比率
金管局推出首輪物業貸款逆周期措施前推出供款與入息比率上限

根據金管局於2015年2月推出的第七輪逆周期措施，使用內部評級基準計算法計算信用風險資本要求的認可機構須將15%信用風險加權下限的應用，由新造按揭貸款延伸至整個住宅按揭貸款組合。這項規定於2016年6月生效。

年內有更多地產發展商向物業買家直接提供按揭貸款，其按揭成數往往高於金管局對認可機構實施審慎要求下許可的水平。金管局密切留意有關發展，並定期與認可機構溝通，以評估銀行有否繼續有效管理對地產發展商的風險承擔。此外，土地註冊處應金管局要求，同意向認可機構提供電子提示服務。使用這項服務的認可機構，當有其他按揭文書就其承按的物業交付土地註冊處辦理註冊時，會收到該處發出的電子提示訊息。這項服務將有助應對按揭借款人未有事先獲得承按認可機構同意下，擅自以同一物業借取額外按揭貸款的情況。土地註冊處已於2017年第1季推出電子提示服務。

# 業務操作及科技風險的監管

與其他國際金融中心一樣，香港面對的網絡威脅與日俱增。金管局於2016年接到認可機構通報發現未經授權股票交易及試圖入侵其支付系統的個案，並隨即採取行動應對這些攻擊造成的風險。金管局發出電子銀行服務提示，提醒公眾慎防網上股票交易騙案，並建議公眾採取預防措施。金管局又向認可機構發出通告，就進一步加強網上銀行服務監控可採取的保安措施提供指引。有關試圖入侵銀行支付系統的個案，金管局在香港首次發現相關個案時已提醒認可機構留意這類騙案，並在警方協助下說明這類騙案的犯案手法，以及要求認可機構在加強支付操作的監控措施時須顧及有關手法。

為進一步提升銀行體系應對網絡風險的能力，金管局於2016年5月推出網絡防衛計劃。此計劃由三項支柱組成，即網絡防衛評估框架、專業培訓計劃及網絡風險資訊共享平台（詳見「香港的國際金融中心地位」一章「金融科技促進辦公室」部分）。金管局在12月向認可機構發出通告，列載網絡防衛評估框架的實施時間表。

金融科技在銀行業的應用於2016年長足發展，多間認可機構推出新的金融科技產品，其中個人小額支付服務、非接觸式流動支付及生物認證這幾個範疇的發展尤為顯著。金管局在9月推出「金融科技監管沙盒」，讓認可機構能在受控環境中就其金融科技項目先作試行，而無需完全符合金管局的監管規定。有關安排讓認可機構在正式推出金融科技服務前，可及早收集真實數據及用戶意見，以便作出適當修改。截至2016年底，共有6項使用金融科技監管沙盒的申請獲批，有關的新金融科技產品涉及生物認證、證券交易及用於按揭估值的區塊鏈。金管局又在11月上調無需雙重認證的網上銀行個人小額支付服務的交易上限至每個帳戶每日5,000港元，以應付日益增加的簡便個人支付服務需求。

2016年發生多宗與物業相關的騙案，當中涉及騙徒假扮業主，試圖藉申請按揭貸款或出售有關物業謀取利益。雖然這些騙案並不涉及認可機構，但金管局仍與警方及香港銀行公會（銀行公會）緊密合作，就偵測及防止這些騙案在銀行業內發生向認可機構提供指引。年內金管局出版兩期《操作事故通訊》，與業界分享從認可機構發生過的操作事故中汲取的教訓。金管局亦對認可機構的業務操作風險管理制度、詐騙管理方法、信託╱託管業務操作及防範違規或未經授權交易活動的風險管理及監控措施進行現場審查及專題評估。

# 財資業務及流動性風險的監管

2016年發生數宗重大政治事件，引致金融市場在年內多次大幅波動。與此同時，美國利率繼續緩慢地正常化，聯邦公開市場委員會於12月決定調高聯邦基金利率，是全球金融危機以來的第二次。為應對這些政治事件作好準備，金管局與境外監管機構繼續保持緊密聯繫，並評估事件對香港銀行體系的影響，以及要求銀行保持警覺並加強其風險管理以應對不利的市場發展。

在流動性風險管理方面，金管局進行額外的流動性壓力測試，以評估銀行體系應對可能發生的嚴峻壓力情境的能力，並對認可機構作出跟進，以加強其應對能力。金管局在2015年針對利率風險管理進行一輪現場審查後，再進行額外的現場審查，以評估認可機構的市場風險管理，並要求在監控方面存有不足的認可機構作出糾正。

# 打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集活動

金管局的風險為本打擊洗錢監管包括現場審查及非現場審查（包括就特定事件與認可機構進行的監管聯繫），主要針對洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集風險較高的範疇。審查內容涵蓋認可機構對洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集風險的評估、風險為本方法的落實情況，以及交易監察與制裁合規的制度和程序。金管局的專項監管人員在2016年共進行17次現場審查及30次非現場審查。

在政策發展方面，金管局優先處理某些行業及人士在開立銀行帳戶方面遇到困難的情況，並發出指引與「常見問題」，以釐清若干客戶盡職審查的規定，以及金管局就風險為本方法的監管期望。與此同時，金管局繼續與業內公會緊密合作，發出指引以協助認可機構處理某些範疇的風險，例如貿易相關的洗錢活動。

# Banking system stability

Despite increased global market risks and turbulence, the banking sector in Hong Kong remains sound in 2016. The HKMA strengthened the risk governance framework and the effectiveness of credit and liquidity risk management systems of authorised institutions throughout the year. In the light of increasingly frequent cyber attacks, the HKMA also enhanced its supervision of authorised institutions’ technology risk management. To further its commitment to combating financial crime, the effectiveness of authorised institutions’ anti-money laundering and counter-terrorist financing controls remains a supervisory priority for the HKMA. Regarding the conduct of authorised institutions, the HKMA took concrete action to promote a customer-centric corporate culture and promote financial inclusion, and to cope with the difficulties faced by overseas SMEs and start-ups in opening and maintaining bank accounts in Hong Kong. The HKMA also strengthened its supervision of the practices of authorised institutions in the sale of investment and insurance products, to further enhance protection for customers.

In terms of supervisory policy, the HKMA has made significant progress in its preparations for the implementation of international supervisory and accounting standards in Hong Kong, including maintaining... stability of the net stable funding ratio, limits on large exposures, International Financial Reporting Standard 9, and the resolution framework under the “Financial Institutions (Resolution System) Ordinance”.

# 2016 in 2016 Review

# Regulatory work overview

In 2016, the HKMA conducted 188 off-site reviews covering a wide range of areas, including authorised institutions’ CAMEL rating, corporate governance, business operations and risk management. The HKMA strengthened its communication with the board of directors of authorised institutions to enhance risk governance and corporate culture in the banking sector. In addition to holding meetings with the board of directors or Board committees, the HKMA also met separately with independent non-executive directors (IneDs) to exchange feedback on corporate culture and risk governance matters. The HKMA also held tripartite meetings with authorised institutions and their external auditors. Furthermore, the HKMA assessed whether the remuneration system of authorised institutions helped promote effective risk management.

In terms of capital adequacy levels, the HKMA reviews the capital plans of authorised institutions, including their capital targets for the coming years, in order to be well-prepared for the full implementation of the Basel III capital Buffer in 2019. The stress testing of authorised institutions’ repayable capacity was also improved in accordance with the current macro economic environment. The HKMA also carefully assesses the recovery plans of major retail banks and provides comments on areas for improvement.

In addition to off-site review operations, the HKMA continued to conduct thematic assessments in conjunction with regular on-site inspections, with thematic assessments primarily applicable to categories assessed as high-risk. This regulatory approach allows the HKMA to more effectively allocate supervisory resources to cope with the various increased and major risks faced by authorised institutions. The HKMA conducted a total of 377 on-site inspections and thematic assessments in 2016. The focus of these inspections and assessments remains credit risk management and controls, particularly concerning credit risk related to business within the Mainland; another focus is combating anti-money laundering and terrorist financing fund-raising measures. The HKMA also increased the number of on-site inspections and thematic assessments related to liquidity risk, operations risk, and technology risk management. During the year, a dedicated review team also conducted on-site inspections of authorised institutions’ securities, investment products, insurance, and mandatory provident fund (MPF) related business.

Chart 1 containing the Hong Kong Monetary Authority’s regulatory work overview in 2016.

# Credit risks regulation

# Credit growth and asset quality

banks’ loan grew moderately in 2016. The total amount of outstanding loans increased by 6.5% for the whole year; the rate of change in 2015 was 3.5% (Chart 2). As customer deposit increases over loan increases, the overall lending rate decreased from 70.1% at the end of 2015 to 68.4% at the end of 2016.

Chart 2: Growth of loans and advances.

Within the mainland, the total amount of related loans increased by 7% to 35,640 billion Hong Kong dollar(s) (Chart 3), including 545 billion Hong Kong dollar(s) in loans booked by subsidiaries of banks registered in Hong Kong.

The banking sector’s asset quality remained sound in 2016. Despite the specific classified loans ratio of retail banks rising slightly from 0.69% at the end of 2015 to 0.72% at the end of 2016, it remained well below the long-term average of 2.4% since 2000. During the same period, the overall banking sector’s specific classified loans ratio rose from 0.73% to 0.85%. Within the year, the asset quality of mainland-related loans in the banking sector showed similar trends; during the same period, the specific classified loans ratio of these loans in retail banks rose slightly from 0.78% to 0.82%, and the overall banking sector’s related ratio also rose slightly from 0.77% a year before to 0.80%.

The HKMA is investing significant supervisory resources to ensure authorised institutions continue to adopt prudent credit approval standards and maintain effective loan classification and provisioning systems. The HKMA also pays special attention, during the supervisory process, to the increasing exposure of authorised institutions to risks associated with Chinese enterprises, as well as the credit risks arising from investments in debt securities to increase returns. In addition, the HKMA is conducting a thematic assessment of the credit risk management of authorised institutions distributing high-risk investment products.

# Property mortgage loans

The HKMA continues to closely monitor property lending business of authorised institutions. Residential property prices began to adjust in September 2015, but then rose again in March 2016, increasing by 8% for the whole year. The average loan-to-value (LTV) ratio for newly granted residential mortgage loans decreased from 64% in September 2009, before the HKMA launched the first round of counter-cyclical mortgage measures, to 51% in December 2016. The average debt-to-income ratio for newly granted residential mortgage loans also decreased from 41% in August 2010, when the debt-to-income ratio cap was first introduced, to 34% in December 2016 (Chart 1).

Chart 1: Average loan-to-value (LTV) ratio and debt-to-income ratio for newly granted residential property loans
Before the HKMA launched counter-cyclical measures for first-time property loans, it introduced a debt-to-income ratio cap.

According to the HKMA’s seventh round of countercyclical measures launched in February 2015, institutions authorised to use the internal ratings-based approach to calculate credit risk capital requirements must extend the application of the 15% credit risk weighting lower... limit from newly granted mortgage loans to the entire residential mortgage loan portfolio. This regulation took effect in June 2016.

Within the year, more real estate developers have directly provided loans to property buyers, and their loan-to-value (LTV) ratio is often higher than the levels permitted under the HKMA’s prudential requirements for authorised institutions. The HKMA closely monitors this development and communicates regularly with authorised institutions to assess whether banks continue to effectively manage their exposure to real estate developers. In addition, the Land Registry, at the request of the HKMA, has agreed to provide e-tips services to authorised institutions. Authorised institutions using this service will receive electronic message issued by the Section when other mortgage documents for the properties on which they bear a charge are submitted to the Land Registry for registration. This service will help cope with situations where mortgage borrowers, without prior consent from the charging authorised institutions, independently obtain additional loans secured by the same property. The Land Registry launched the e-tips service in the first quarter of 2017.

# Regulation of business operations and technological risks.

With other international financial centre’s, Hong Kong is faced with Cybersecurity threats increasingly growing. The HKMA received reports from authorised institutions in 2016 regarding unauthorised equities trading and attempts to enter their payment systems, and immediately took operations to cope with the risks caused by these attacks. The HKMA issued e-banking service tips, reminding the public to beware of online stocks scams, and proposed the public take preventative measures. The HKMA also issued a notice to authorised institutions, providing guidance on security measures that could be taken to further advance online banking service controls. Regarding the case(s) of attempts to enter bank payment systems, the HKMA alerted authorised institutions when it first discovered related case(s) in Hong Kong, and explained the practices of these scams with the assistance of the police, and required authorised institutions to consider these practices when strengthening controls on payment operations.

To further enhance the resilience of the banking system to cope with cyber risks, the HKMA launched the Cybersecurity Fortification Initiative in May 2016. This programme consists of three pillars: a cybersecurity defense assessment framework, a professional talent development programme and a cyber risk information sharing platform (see the “Hong Kong’s International financial centre status” chapter, “Fintech Facilitation office” section for details). The HKMA issued a notice to authorised institutions in December, detailing the implementation timeline for the cybersecurity defense assessment framework.

The application of Fintech in the banking sector saw significant development in 2016, with a number of authorised institutions launching new Fintech products. Among these, the development of person-to-person small-value payments, contactless mobile payments and biometric authentication was particularly remarkable. The HKMA launched the “Fintech Regulatory Sandbox” in September, allowing authorised institutions to conduct pilot trials of their Fintech projects in a contained environment without needing to fully comply with the HKMA’s regulatory requirements. This arrangement allows authorised institutions to collect real data and user feedback early on, before the formal launch of Fintech services, so as to make appropriate amendments. As of the end of 2016, six applications for the use of the Fintech Regulatory Sandbox were approved, and the new Fintech products involved biometric authentication, securities trading and blockchain for mortgage valuation. The HKMA also adjusted upwards the transaction limit for online banking person-to-person small-value payment services that do not require dual authentication to HK$5,000 per account daily in November, to help cope with the increasing demand for convenient personal payment services.

In 2016, multiple incidents related to property fraud occurred, including fraudsters posing as property owners attempting to obtain benefits by applying for mortgage loans or the sale of the relevant properties. Although these incidents did not involve authorised institutions, the HKMA remained in close cooperation with the Police and the Hong Kong Association of Banks (banks’ Association) to provide guidance to authorised institutions on detecting and preventing these incidents within the banking sector. During the year, the HKMA published two issues of “operations incident communications”, sharing lessons learned from operational incidents that had occurred in authorised institutions with the industry. The HKMA also conducted on-site reviews and thematic assessment of authorised institutions’ business operations risk management system, fraud management practices, trust/custody business operations, and risk management and controls for preventing irregularities or unauthorised trading activities.

# Treasury business and liquidity risk regulation.

In 2016, several major political events occurred, leading to markedly volatility in financial markets multiple times throughout the year. At the same time, US interest rates continued to normalisation slowly, and the Federal Open Market Committee decided to raise the Federal Fund rate in December, which was the second time since the global financial crisis. To be well-prepared to cope with these political events, the HKMA and overseas supervisory institutions continued to maintain close contact, and assess the impact of the events on the Hong Kong banking system, as well as requiring banks to stay vigilant and strengthen their risk management to deal with adverse market development.

In terms of liquidity risk management, the HKMA conducted additional liquidity stress tests to evaluate the banking system’s ability to cope with potentially severe stress scenarios, and undertook follow-up actions with authorised institutions to further strengthen their resilience. Following a round of on-site examination of interest rate risk management in 2015, the HKMA conducted additional on-site reviews to assess the market risks management of authorised institutions, and required those institutions with insufficient controls to make corrections.

# Combating anti-money laundering and the raising (of funds) for terrorist activities.

The HKMA’s risk-based anti-money laundering supervision includes on-site examination and off-site examination (including supervisory engagement with authorised institutions in respect of specific events), primarily aimed at areas with higher money laundering and terrorist financing risks. The examination content covers authorised institutions’ assessment of money laundering and terrorist financing risks, implementation of risk-based approaches, and systems and procedures for transaction monitoring and sanctions compliance. The HKMA’s professional supervisory staff conducted a total of 17 on-site examinations and 30 off-site examinations in 2016.

In terms of policy Development, the HKMA prioritises addressing the difficulties certain industries and person face in opening bank accounts, and issued guidelines with “Frequently Asked Questions” to clarify certain customer due diligence requirements, as well as the HKMA’s supervisory expectations for a risk-based approach. At the same time, the HKMA continues to cooperate closely with industry Association, issue guidelines to help authorised institutions handle certain categories of risks, such as trade-related anti-money laundering activities.

# 香港的國際金融中心地位

香港維持其作為全球離岸人民幣業務樞紐的地位。去年的稅務修訂有助營造有利環境，吸引跨國公司在港設立企業財資中心。為發展香港成為基建融資中心與金融科技樞紐，金管局在年內成立基建融資促進辦公室及金融科技促進辦公室。年內金管局向儲值支付工具發行人批出13個牌照。香港穩健的財政表現及龐大的對外資產淨值，繼續獲得信貸評級機構確認，其中標準普爾維持對香港AAA的評級。

# 概覽

受到環球金融市場波動及人民幣匯率前景不確定性影響，2016年全球離岸人民幣業務有所放緩。儘管如此，香港維持其作為全球離岸人民幣業務樞紐的地位，處理全球約七成人民幣支付交易。深港股票市場交易互聯互通機制「深港通」於12月推出，標誌着內地資本帳開放的另一里程碑，並且是提升香港的國際金融中心地位的重要一步。金管局亦透過擴大對市場的人民幣流動性支援及推出措施增加人民幣市場流動性的透明度，強化金融基建。

金管局於7月成立基建融資促進辦公室(IFFO)，透過匯聚主要持份者促進基建發展，並發展香港成為基建融資中心。截至2017年1月底，已有超過60間機構加入IFFO成為合作夥伴。年內金管局亦成功推動法例修訂的通過，以消除稅務不對稱及提供稅務優惠，鼓勵跨國及內地公司在香港設立企業財資中心，為金融及專業服務行業帶來更多商機。在香港駐設業務的機構投資者數目亦逐漸增加，其中作為全球第三大主權基金的阿布扎比投資局於10月宣布在香港成立海外辦事處，是該機構唯一設於阿布扎比以外的辦事處。

國際貨幣基金組織（基金組織）在去年的第四條磋商討論中對我們致力鞏固香港作為國際金融中心的地位給予正面評價。年內金管局積極參與國際討論，致力推進全球與區內金融穩定。金管局亦與國際信貸評級機構保持緊密溝通，有關工作有助香港的信貸評級在2016年獲得主要信貸評級機構確認。

香港金融基建的安全有效運作與持續發展，對鞏固香港作為國際金融中心及全球離岸人民幣業務樞紐的競爭力發揮重要作用。處理銀行同業交易的4個即時支付結算(RTGS)系統及債務工具中央結算系統（CMU系統）在2016年達到100%的系統可供使用率，高於99.95%的目標水平。

金管局在2016年進一步加強香港的零售支付金融基建。年內根據2016年11月全面生效的《支付系統及儲值支付工具條例》（《支付條例》）批出總共13個儲值支付工具牌照。電子支票服務涵蓋範圍亦已擴展至香港和廣東省（包括深圳）之間的跨境支付。

為促進香港金融科技的發展，金管局於3月成立金融科技促進辦公室。年內實施的多項重要措施均取得理想進展。

金管局推出一系列措施加強銀行業軟實力，包括(i)推出提升董事專業能力計劃；(ii)訂立整體業界的銀行從業員專業資歷架構；及(iii)推行消費者教育計劃。

# 2016年回顧

# 離岸人民幣業務

2016年環球金融市場波動及人民幣匯率前景不確定性令全球離岸人民幣業務有所放緩。截至年底，香港人民幣客戶存款及存款證餘額合共為6,251億元人民幣，較上年減少38%（圖1）。年內離岸人民幣債券發行量降至528億元人民幣，經香港銀行處理的人民幣貿易結算額亦降至45,421億元人民幣。另一方面，香港銀行截至年底的人民幣貸款餘額為2,948億元人民幣，與上年相若（圖2）。人民幣RTGS系統的交易額維持於高位，於2016年平均每日處理的交易額為8,636億元人民幣。由此可見，儘管人民幣資金池有所縮減，但仍繼續支持大量人民幣金融中介活動在香港進行。根據環球銀行金融電信協會(SWIFT)統計數字，2016年香港處理約七成人民幣支付交易，足以證明香港作為全球離岸人民幣業務樞紐的地位。
